intro: Polygala huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén polygala, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in regions of Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes a variety of herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, often hairy leaves and clusters of small, spiny flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
